notes.text:
An update for libxml2 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The libxml2 library is a development toolbox providing the implementation of various XML standards.

Security Fix(es):

* libxml2: integer overflows with XML_PARSE_HUGE (CVE-2022-40303)

* libxml2: dict corruption caused by entity reference cycles (CVE-2022-40304)

* libxml2: NULL dereference in xmlSchemaFixupComplexType (CVE-2023-28484)

* libxml2: Hashing of empty dict strings isn't deterministic (CVE-2023-29469)

* libxml2: crafted xml can cause global buffer overflow (CVE-2023-39615)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in libxml2. Parsing a XML document with the XML_PARSE_HUGE option enabled can result in an integer overflow because safety checks were missing in some functions. Also, the xmlParseEntityValue function didn't have any length limitation.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: integer overflows with XML_PARSE_HUGE
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw is only triggered when parsing a multi-gigabyte XML document with the XML_PARSE_HUGE option enabled, and the most likely impact of this flaw is a Denial of Service in the application linked to the library. To reflect these conditions, Red Hat Product Security has rated this flaw as having a moderate security impact.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The desktop must be restarted (log out, then log back in) for this update to take effect.

notes.text: A flaw was found in libxml2. When a reference cycle is detected in the XML entity cleanup function the XML entity data can be stored in a dictionary. In this case, the dictionary becomes corrupted resulting in logic errors, including memory errors like double free.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: dict corruption caused by entity reference cycles
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The most likely impact of this flaw is a Denial of Service in the application linked to the library. To reflect this, Red Hat Product Security has rated this flaw as having a moderate security impact.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The desktop must be restarted (log out, then log back in) for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libxml2: dict corruption caused by entity reference cycles

notes.text: A NULL pointer dereference vulnerability was found in libxml2. This issue occurs when parsing (invalid) XML schemas.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: NULL dereference in xmlSchemaFixupComplexType
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The desktop must be restarted (log out, then log back in) for this update to take effect.

notes.text: A flaw was found in libxml2. This issue occurs when hashing empty strings which aren't null-terminated, xmlDictComputeFastKey could produce inconsistent results, which may lead to various logic or memory errors, including double free errors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: Hashing of empty dict strings isn't deterministic
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The desktop must be restarted (log out, then log back in) for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libxml2: Hashing of empty dict strings isn't deterministic

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: A flaw was found in Libxml2, where it contains a global buffer overflow via the xmlSAX2StartElement() function at /libxml2/SAX2.c. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a denial of service (DoS) by supplying a crafted XML file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: crafted xml can cause global buffer overflow
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The desktop must be restarted (log out, then log back in) for this update to take effect.
